function.name: openspace.absPath
function.description: Passes the argument to FileSystem::absolutePath, which resolves occuring path tokens and returns the absolute path.

function.name: openspace.addCustomProperty
function.description:
Creates a new property that lives in the `UserProperty` group.

\param identifier The identifier that is going to be used for the new property \param type The type of the property, has to be one of "DMat2Property", "DMat3Property", "DMat4Property", "Mat2Property", "Mat3Property", "Mat4Property", "BoolProperty", "DoubleProperty", "FloatProperty", "IntProperty", "StringProperty", "StringListProperty", "LongProperty", "ShortProperty", "UIntProperty", "ULongProperty", "DVec2Property", "DVec3Property", "DVec4Property", "IVec2Property", "IVec3Property", "IVec4Property", "UVec2Property", "UVec3Property", "UVec4Property", "Vec2Property", "Vec3Property", "Vec4Property" \param guiName The name that the property uses in the user interface. If this value is not provided, the `identifier` is used instead \param description A description what the property is used for \param onChange A Lua script that will be executed whenever the property changes

function.name: openspace.addSceneGraphNode
function.description: Loads the SceneGraphNode described in the table and adds it to the SceneGraph.

function.name: openspace.addScreenSpaceRenderable
function.description: / Will create a ScreenSpaceRenderable from a lua Table and add it in the RenderEngine

function.name: openspace.addTag
function.description: Adds a Tag to a SceneGraphNode identified by the provided uri

function.name: openspace.addToPropertyValue
function.description: Add a value to the property with the given identifier. Works on both numerical and string properties, where adding to a string property means appending the given string value to the existing string value.

function.name: openspace.appendToListProperty
function.description: Add a value to the list property with the given identifier. The value can be any type, as long as it is the correct type for the given property. Note that a number will be converted to a string automatically.

function.name: openspace.bindKey
function.description: Binds a key to Lua command to both execute locally and broadcast to all clients if this node is hosting a parallel connection.

function.name: openspace.boundingSphere
function.description: Returns the bounding sphere of the scene graph node with the given string as identifier.

function.name: openspace.clearKey
function.description: Unbinds the key or keys that have been provided. This function can be called with a single key or with an array of keys to remove all of the provided keys at once.

function.name: openspace.clearKeys
function.description: Clear all key bindings

function.name: openspace.configuration
function.description: Returns the whole configuration object as a Dictionary

function.name: openspace.createDirectory
function.description: Creates a directory at the provided path, returns true if directory was newly created and false otherwise. If `recursive` flag is set to true, it will automatically create any missing parent folder as well

function.name: openspace.createSingleColorImage
function.description: Creates a 1 pixel image with a certain color in the cache folder and returns the path to the file. If a cached file with the given name already exists, the path to that file is returned. The first argument is the name of the file, without extension. The second is the RGB color, given as {r, g, b} with values between 0 and 1.

function.name: openspace.directoryExists
function.description: Checks whether the provided directory exists.

function.name: openspace.directoryForPath
function.description: This function extracts the directory part of the passed path. For example, if the parameter is 'C:\\OpenSpace\\foobar\\foo.txt', this function returns 'C:\\OpenSpace\\foobar'.

function.name: openspace.downloadFile
function.description: Downloads a file from Lua interpreter

function.name: openspace.dpiScaling
function.description: Extracts the DPI scaling for either the GUI window or if there is no dedicated GUI window, the first window.

function.name: openspace.fadeIn
function.description: Fades in the node(s) with the given identifier over the given time in seconds. The identifier can contain a tag and/or a wildcard to target several nodes. If the fade time is not provided then the 'OpenSpaceEngine.FadeDuration' property will be used instead. If the third argument (endScript) is provided then that script will be run after the fade is finished.

function.name: openspace.fadeOut
function.description: Fades out the node(s) with the given identifier over the given time in seconds. The identifier can contain a tag and/or a wildcard to target several nodes. If the fade time is not provided then the 'OpenSpaceEngine.FadeDuration' property will be used instead. If the third argument (endScript) is provided then that script will be run after the fade is finished.

function.name: openspace.fileExists
function.description: Checks whether the provided file exists.

function.name: openspace.getProperty
function.description: Returns a list of property identifiers that match the passed regular expression

function.name: openspace.getPropertyValue
function.description: Returns the value the property, identified by the provided URI. Deprecated in favor of the 'propertyValue' function

function.name: openspace.hasMission
function.description: Returns whether a mission with the provided name has been loaded.

function.name: openspace.hasProperty
function.description: Returns whether a property with the given URI exists

function.name: openspace.hasSceneGraphNode
function.description: Checks whether the specifies SceneGraphNode is present in the current scene.

function.name: openspace.interactionSphere
function.description: Returns the interaction sphere of the scene graph node with the given string as identifier.

function.name: openspace.invertBooleanProperty
function.description: Inverts the value of a boolean property with the given identifier

function.name: openspace.isMaster
function.description: Returns whether the current OpenSpace instance is the master node of a cluster configuration. If this instance is not part of a cluster, this function also returns 'true'.

function.name: openspace.keyBindings
function.description: Returns the strings of the script that are bound to the passed key and whether they were local or remote key binds.

function.name: openspace.layerServer
function.description: Returns the current layer server from the configuration

function.name: openspace.loadJson
function.description: Loads the provided JSON file and returns it back to the caller. Please note that if the JSON contains keys that array of an array type, they are converted into a Dictionary with numerical keys and the numerical keys start with 1.

function.name: openspace.loadMission
function.description: Load mission phases from file.

function.name: openspace.makeIdentifier
function.description: Create a valid identifier from the provided input string. Will replace invalid characters like whitespaces and some punctuation marks with valid alternatives

function.name: openspace.markInterestingNodes
function.description: This function marks the scene graph nodes identified by name as interesting, which will provide shortcut access to focus buttons and featured properties

function.name: openspace.markInterestingTimes
function.description: This function marks interesting times for the current scene, which will create shortcuts for a quick access

function.name: openspace.nodeByRenderableType
function.description: Returns a list of all scene graph nodes in the scene that have a renderable of the specific type

function.name: openspace.printDebug
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Debug'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.printError
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Error'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.printFatal
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Fatal'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.printInfo
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Info'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.printTrace
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Trace'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.printWarning
function.description: Logs the passed value to the installed LogManager with a LogLevel of 'Warning'. For Boolean, numbers, and strings, the internal values are printed, for all other types, the type is printed instead

function.name: openspace.property
function.description: Returns a list of property identifiers that match the passed regular expression

function.name: openspace.propertyValue
function.description: Returns the value the property, identified by the provided URI. Deprecated in favor of the 'propertyValue' function

function.name: openspace.readCSVFile
function.description: Loads the CSV file provided as a parameter and returns it as a vector containing the values of the each row. The inner vector has the same number of values as the CSV has columns. The second parameter controls whether the first entry in the returned outer vector is containing the names of the columns

function.name: openspace.readFile
function.description: Reads a file from disk and return its contents.

function.name: openspace.rebindKey
function.description: Rebinds all scripts from the old key (first argument) to the new key (second argument)

function.name: openspace.removeInterestingNodes
function.description: This function removes unmarks the scene graph nodes identified by name as interesting, thus removing the shortcuts from the features properties list

function.name: openspace.removeSceneGraphNode
function.description: Removes the SceneGraphNode identified by name or by extracting the 'Identifier' key if the parameter is a table.

function.name: openspace.removeSceneGraphNodesFromRegex
function.description: Removes all SceneGraphNodes with identifiers matching the input regular expression.

function.name: openspace.removeScreenSpaceRenderable
function.description: Given a ScreenSpaceRenderable name this script will remove it from the RenderEngine. The parameter can also be a table in which case the 'Identifier' key is used to look up the name from the table.

function.name: openspace.removeTag
function.description: Removes a tag (second argument) from a scene graph node (first argument)

function.name: openspace.resetCamera
function.description: Resets the camera position to the same position where the profile originally started

function.name: openspace.resetScreenshotNumber
function.description: Reset screenshot index to 0.

function.name: openspace.saveSettingsToProfile
function.description: Collects all changes that have been made since startup, including all property changes and assets required, requested, or removed. All changes will be added to the profile that OpenSpace was started with, and the new saved file will contain all of this information. If the argument is provided, the settings will be saved into new profile with that name. If the argument is blank, the current profile will be saved to a backup file and the original profile will be overwritten. The second argument determines if a file that already exists should be overwritten, which is 'false' by default.

function.name: openspace.sceneGraphNodes
function.description: Returns a list of all scene graph nodes in the scene

function.name: openspace.screenSpaceRenderables
function.description: Returns a list of all screen-space renderables

function.name: openspace.setCurrentMission
function.description: Set the currnet mission.

function.name: openspace.setDefaultDashboard
function.description: This function sets the default values for the dashboard consisting of 'DashboardItemDate', 'DashboardItemSimulationIncrement', 'DashboardItemDistance', 'DashboardItemFramerate', and 'DashboardItemParallelConnection'

function.name: openspace.setDefaultGuiSorting
function.description: This function sets the default GUI sorting for the space environment to increasing size, from solar system, through Milky Way, Universe and finishing with other elements

function.name: openspace.setParent
function.description: The scene graph node identified by the first string is reparented to be a child of the scene graph node identified by the second string.

function.name: openspace.setPathToken
function.description: Registers the path token provided by the first argument to the path in the second argument. If the path token already exists, it will be silently overridden.

function.name: openspace.setPropertyValue
function.description:
Sets all property(s) identified by the URI (with potential wildcards) in the first argument. The second argument can be any type, but it has to match the type that the property (or properties) expect. If the third is not present or is '0', the value changes instantly, otherwise the change will take that many seconds and the value is interpolated at each step in between. The fourth parameter is an optional easing function if a 'duration' has been specified. If 'duration' is 0, this parameter value is ignored. Otherwise, it can be one of many supported easing functions. See easing.h for available functions. The fifth argument is another Lua script that will be executed when the interpolation provided in parameter 3 finishes.
The URI is interpreted using a wildcard in which '*' is expanded to '(.*)' and bracketed components '{ }' are interpreted as group tag names. Then, the passed value will be set on all properties that fit the regex + group name combination.

function.name: openspace.setPropertyValueSingle
function.description:
Sets the property identified by the URI in the first argument. The second argument can be any type, but it has to match the type that the property expects. If the third is not present or is '0', the value changes instantly, otherwise the change will take that many seconds and the value is interpolated at each step in between. The fourth parameter is an optional easing function if a 'duration' has been specified. If 'duration' is 0, this parameter value is ignored. Otherwise, it has to be one of the easing functions defined in the list below. This is the same as calling the setValue method and passing 'single' as the fourth argument to setPropertyValue. The fifth argument is another Lua script that will be executed when the interpolation provided in parameter 3 finishes.
 Avaiable easing functions: Linear, QuadraticEaseIn, QuadraticEaseOut, QuadraticEaseInOut, CubicEaseIn, CubicEaseOut, CubicEaseInOut, QuarticEaseIn, QuarticEaseOut, QuarticEaseInOut, QuinticEaseIn, QuinticEaseOut, QuinticEaseInOut, SineEaseIn, SineEaseOut, SineEaseInOut, CircularEaseIn, CircularEaseOut, CircularEaseInOut, ExponentialEaseIn, ExponentialEaseOut, ExponentialEaseInOut, ElasticEaseIn, ElasticEaseOut, ElasticEaseInOut, BounceEaseIn, BounceEaseOut, BounceEaseInOut

function.name: openspace.setScreenshotFolder
function.description: Sets the folder used for storing screenshots or session recording frames

function.name: openspace.takeScreenshot
function.description: Take a screenshot and return the screenshot number. The screenshot will be stored in the ${SCREENSHOTS} folder.

function.name: openspace.toggleFade
function.description:
Toggles the fade state of the node(s) with the given identifier over the given
          time in seconds. The identifier can contain a tag and/or a wildcard to target
          several nodes. If the fade time is not provided then the
          "OpenSpaceEngine.FadeDuration" property will be used instead. If the third
          argument (endScript) is provided then that script will be run after the fade
          is finished.

function.name: openspace.toggleShutdown
function.description: Toggles the shutdown mode that will close the application after the countdown timer is reached

function.name: openspace.unloadMission
function.description: Unloads a previously loaded mission.

function.name: openspace.unzipFile
function.description: This function extracts the contents of a zip file. The first argument is the path to the zip file. The second argument is the directory where to put the extracted files. If the third argument is true, the compressed file will be deleted after the decompression is finished.

function.name: openspace.version
function.description: This function returns information about the current OpenSpace version. The resulting table has the structure: \code Version = { Major = <number> Minor = <number> Patch = <number> }, Commit = <string> Branch = <string> \endcode

function.name: openspace.walkDirectory
function.description: Walks a directory and returns the contents of the directory as absolute paths. The first argument is the path of the directory that should be walked, the second argument determines if the walk is recursive and will continue in contained directories. The default value for this parameter is "false". The third argument determines whether the table that is returned is sorted. The default value for this parameter is "false".

function.name: openspace.walkDirectoryFiles
function.description: Walks a directory and returns the files of the directory as absolute paths. The first argument is the path of the directory that should be walked, the second argument determines if the walk is recursive and will continue in contained directories. The default value for this parameter is "false". The third argument determines whether the table that is returned is sorted. The default value for this parameter is "false".

function.name: openspace.walkDirectoryFolders
function.description: Walks a directory and returns the subfolders of the directory as absolute paths. The first argument is the path of the directory that should be walked, the second argument determines if the walk is recursive and will continue in contained directories. The default value for this parameter is "false". The third argument determines whether the table that is returned is sorted. The default value for this parameter is "false".

function.name: openspace.worldPosition
function.description: Returns the world position of the scene graph node with the given string as identifier.

function.name: openspace.worldRotation
function.description: Returns the world rotation matrix of the scene graph node with the given string as identifier.

function.name: openspace.writeDocumentation
function.description: Writes out documentation files

function.name: openspace.action.action
function.description: Returns information about the action as a table with the keys 'Identifier', 'Command', 'Name', 'Documentation', 'GuiPath', and 'Synchronization'.

function.name: openspace.action.actions
function.description: Returns all registered actions in the system as a table of tables each containing the keys 'Identifier', 'Command', 'Name', 'Documentation', 'GuiPath', and 'Synchronization'.

function.name: openspace.action.hasAction
function.description: Checks if the passed identifier corresponds to an action.

function.name: openspace.action.registerAction
function.description: Registers a new action. The first argument is the identifier which cannot have been used to register a previous action before, the second argument is the Lua command that is to be executed, and the optional third argument is the name used in a user-interface to refer to this action. The fourth is a human readable description of the command for documentation purposes. The fifth is the GUI path and the last parameter determines whether the action should be executed locally (= false) or remotely (= true, the default).

function.name: openspace.action.removeAction
function.description: Removes an existing action from the list of possible actions. The action is identifies either by the passed name, or if it is a table, the value behind the 'Identifier' key is extract and used instead.

function.name: openspace.action.triggerAction
function.description: Triggers the action given by the specified identifier.

function.name: openspace.asset.add
function.description: Adds an asset to the current scene. The parameter passed into this function is the path to the file that should be loaded.

function.name: openspace.asset.allAssets
function.description: Returns the paths to all loaded assets, loaded directly or indirectly, as a table containing the paths to all loaded assets.

function.name: openspace.asset.isLoaded
function.description: Returns true if the referenced asset already has been loaded. Otherwise false is returned. The parameter to this function is the path of the asset that should be tested.

function.name: openspace.asset.remove
function.description: Removes the asset with the specfied name from the scene. The parameter to this function is the same that was originally used to load this asset, i.e. the path to the asset file.

function.name: openspace.asset.removeAll
function.description: Removes all assets that are currently loaded

function.name: openspace.asset.rootAssets
function.description: Returns the paths to all loaded root assets, which are assets that are loaded directly either through a profile or by calling the `openspace.asset.add` method.

function.name: openspace.audio.currentlyPlaying
function.description:
Returns the list of all tracks that are currently playing.

\return The list of all tracks that are currently playing

function.name: openspace.audio.globalVolume
function.description:
Returns the global volume for all track. The number returned will be greater or equal to 0.

\return The global volume

function.name: openspace.audio.isLooping
function.description:
Returns whether the track referred to by the \p identifier is set to be looping or whether it should played only once. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped \return `Yes` if the track is looping, `No` otherwise

function.name: openspace.audio.isPaused
function.description:
Returns whether the track refered to by the \p identifier is currently playing or paused. If it was be paused through a previous call to #pauseAudio, this function will return `true`. If it has just been created or resumed through a call to #resumeAudio, it will return `false`. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped \return `true` if the track is currently paused, `false` if it is playing

function.name: openspace.audio.isPlaying
function.description:
Returns whether the track referred to by the \p identifier is currently playing. A volume of 0 is still considered to be playing. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped \return `true` if the track is currently playing, `false` otherwise

function.name: openspace.audio.pauseAll
function.description: Pauses the playback for all sounds, while keeping them valid. This function behaves the same as if calling #pauseAudio on all of the sounds that are currently playing.

function.name: openspace.audio.pauseAudio
function.description:
Pauses the playback of the track referred to by the \p identifier. The playback can later be resumed through the #resumeAudio function. Trying to pause an already paused track will not do anything, but is valid. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped

function.name: openspace.audio.playAllFromStart
function.description: Takes all of the sounds that are currently registers, unpauses them and plays them from their starting points

function.name: openspace.audio.playAudio
function.description:
Starts playing the audio file located and the provided \p path. The \p loop parameter determines whether the file is only played once, or on a loop. The sound is later referred to by the \p identifier name. The audio file will be played in "background" mode, which means that each channel will be played at full volume. To play a video using spatial audio, use the #playAudio3d function instead.

\param path The audio file that should be played \param identifier The name for the sound that is used to refer to the sound \param loop If `Yes` then the song will be played in a loop until the program is closed or the playing is stopped through the #stopAudio function

function.name: openspace.audio.playAudio3d
function.description:
Starts playing the audio file located and the provided \p path. The \p loop parameter determines whether the file is only played once, or on a loop. The sound is later referred to by the \p identifier name. The \p position parameter determines the spatial location of the sound in a meter-based coordinate system. The position of the listener is (0,0,0) with the forward direction along the +y axis. This means that the "left" channel in a stereo setting is towards -x and the "right" channel towards x. This default value can be customized through the #set3dListenerParameters function. If you want to play a video without spatial audio, use the #playAudio function instead.

\param path The audio file that should be played \param identifier The name for the sound that is used to refer to the sound \param position The position of the audio file in the 3D environment \param loop If `Yes` then the song will be played in a loop until the program is closed or the playing is stopped through the #stopAudio function

function.name: openspace.audio.resumeAll
function.description: Resumes the playback for all sounds that have been paused. Please note that this will also resume the playback for the sounds that have been manually paused, not just those that were paused through the #pauseAll function.

function.name: openspace.audio.resumeAudio
function.description:
Resumes the playback of a track that was previously paused through the #pauseAudio function. Trying to resume an already playing track will not do anything, but is valid. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped

function.name: openspace.audio.set3dListenerPosition
function.description:
Sets the position and orientation of the listener. This new position is automatically used to adjust the relative position of all 3D tracks. Each parameter to this function call is optional and if a value is omitted, the currently set value continues to be used instead. The coordinate system for the tracks and the listener is a meter-based coordinate system.

\param position The position of the listener. \param lookAt The direction vector of the forward direction \param up The up-vector of the coordinate system

function.name: openspace.audio.set3dSourcePosition
function.description:
Updates the 3D position of a track started through the #playAudio3d function. See that function and the #set3dListenerParameters function for a complete description. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio3d function.

\param handle A valid handle for a track started through the #playAudio3d function \param position The new position from which the track originates

function.name: openspace.audio.setGlobalVolume
function.description:
Sets the global volume for all track referred to the new \p volume. The total for each track is the global volume set by this function multiplied with the volume for the specific track set through the #setVolume function. The default value for the global volume is 0.5. The volume should be a number bigger than 0, where 1 is the maximum volume level. The \p fade controls whether the volume change should be immediately (if it is 0) or over how many seconds it should change. The default is for it to change over 500 ms.

\param volume The new volume level. Must be greater or equal to 0 \param fade How much time the fade from the current volume to the new volume should take

function.name: openspace.audio.setLooping
function.description:
Controls whether the track referred to by the \p identifier should be looping or just be played once. If a track is converted to not looping, it will finish playing until the end of the file. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped \param loop If `Yes` then the song will be played in a loop until the program is closed or the playing is stopped through the #stopAudio function

function.name: openspace.audio.setSpeakerPosition
function.description:
Sets the position of the speaker for the provided \p channel to the provided \p position. In general, this is considered an advanced feature to accommodate non-standard audio environments.

\param channel The channel whose speaker's position should be changed \param position The new position for the speaker

function.name: openspace.audio.setVolume
function.description:
Sets the volume of the track referred to by \p handle to the new \p volume. The volume should be a number bigger than 0, where 1 is the maximum volume level. The \p fade controls whether the volume change should be immediately (if it is 0) or over how many seconds it should change. The default is for it to change over 500 ms.

\param handle The handle to the track whose volume should be changed \param volume The new volume level. Must be greater or equal to 0 \param fade How much time the fade from the current volume to the new volume should take

function.name: openspace.audio.speakerPosition
function.description: Returns the position for the speaker of the provided \p channel. \return The position for the speaker of the provided \p channel

function.name: openspace.audio.stopAll
function.description: Stops all currently playing tracks. After this function, none of the identifiers used to previously play a sound a valid any longer, but can still be used by the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions to start a new sound. This function behaves the same way as if manually calling #stopAudio on all of the sounds that have been started.

function.name: openspace.audio.stopAudio
function.description:
Stops the audio referenced by the \p identifier. The \p identifier must be a name for a sound that was started through the #playAudio or #playAudio3d functions. After this function, the \p identifier can not be used for any other function anymore except for #playAudio or #playAudio3d to start a new sound.

\param identifier The identifier to the track that should be stopped

function.name: openspace.audio.volume
function.description:
Returns the volume for the track referred to by the \p handle. The number returned will be greater or equal to 0.

\return The volume for the track referred to by the \p handle, which will be greater or equal to 0

function.name: openspace.dashboard.addDashboardItem
function.description: Adds a new dashboard item to the main dashboard.

function.name: openspace.dashboard.addDashboardItemToScreenSpace
function.description: Adds a new dashboard item to an existing SceenSpaceDashboard.

function.name: openspace.dashboard.clearDashboardItems
function.description: Removes all dashboard items from the main dashboard.

function.name: openspace.dashboard.removeDashboardItem
function.description: Removes the dashboard item with the specified identifier.

function.name: openspace.dashboard.removeDashboardItemsFromScreenSpace
function.description: Removes all dashboard items from an existing ScreenSpaceDashboard.

function.name: openspace.debugging.addCartesianAxes
function.description: Adds a set of Cartesian axes to the scene graph node identified by the first string, to illustrate its local coordinate system. The second (optional) argument is a scale value, in meters.

function.name: openspace.debugging.removePathControlPoints
function.description: Removes the rendered control points.

function.name: openspace.debugging.removeRenderedCameraPath
function.description: Removes the currently rendered camera path if there is one.

function.name: openspace.debugging.renderCameraPath
function.description: Render the current camera path from the path navigation system. The first optional argument is the number of samples to take along the path (defaults to 100). If a second optional argument is included and set to true, a line indicating the camera view direction along the path will also be rendered. This can be useful when debugging camera orientations. Finally, the third optional argument can be used to set the length (in meter) of the view direction lines.

function.name: openspace.debugging.renderPathControlPoints
function.description: Render the control points for the camera path spline as spheres. The optional argument can be used to set the radius of the created spheres.

function.name: openspace.event.disableEvent
function.description: Disables the event with the provided identifier.

function.name: openspace.event.enableEvent
function.description: Enables the event with the provided identifier.

function.name: openspace.event.registeredEvents
function.description: Returns the list of registered events.

function.name: openspace.event.registerEventAction
function.description: Registers an action to be executed whenever an event is encountered. If the optional third parameter is provided, it describes a filter that the event is being checked against and only if it passes the filter, the action is triggered.

function.name: openspace.event.unregisterEventAction
function.description: Unregisters a specific combination of event, action, and potentially a filter.

function.name: openspace.exoplanets.addExoplanetSystem
function.description: Add one or multiple exoplanet systems to the scene, as specified by the input. An input string should be the name of the system host star.

function.name: openspace.exoplanets.getListOfExoplanets
function.description: Deprecated in favor of 'listOfExoplanets'

function.name: openspace.exoplanets.listOfExoplanets
function.description: Returns a list with names of the host star of all the exoplanet systems that have sufficient data for generating a visualization, based on the module's loaded data file.

function.name: openspace.exoplanets.loadExoplanetsFromCsv
function.description:
Load a set of exoplanets based on custom data, in the form of a CSV file, and add them to the rendering. Can be used to load custom datasets, or more recent planets than what are included in the internal data file that is released with OpenSpace.

The format and column names in the CSV sould be the same as the ones provided by the NASA Exoplanet Archive. https://exoplanetarchive.ipac.caltech.edu/

We recommend downloading the file from the Exoplanet Archive's Composite data table, where multiple sources are combined into one row per planet. https://exoplanetarchive.ipac.caltech.edu /cgi-bin/TblView/nph-tblView?app=ExoTbls&config=PSCompPars

Please remember to include all columns in the file download, as missing data columns may lead to an incomplete visualization.

Also, avoid loading too large files of planets, as each added system will affect the rendering performance.

function.name: openspace.gaia.addClippingBox
function.description: Creates a clipping box for the Gaia renderable in the first argument

function.name: openspace.gaia.addClippingSphere
function.description: Creates a clipping sphere for the Gaia renderable in the first argument

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addBlendingLayersFromDirectory
function.description: Retrieves all info files recursively in the directory passed as the first argument to this function. The color and height tables retrieved from these info files are then added to the RenderableGlobe identified by name passed to the second argument.Usage: openspace.globebrowsing.addBlendingLayersFromDirectory(directory, "Earth")

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addFocusNodeFromLatLong
function.description: Creates a new SceneGraphNode that can be used as focus node. Usage: openspace.globebrowsing.addFocusNodeFromLatLong("Olympus Mons", "Mars", -18.65, 226.2, optionalAltitude)

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addFocusNodesFromDirectory
function.description: Retrieves all info files recursively in the directory passed as the first argument to this function. The name and location retrieved from these info files are then used to create new SceneGraphNodes that can be used as focus nodes. Usage: openspace.globebrowsing.addFocusNodesFromDirectory(directory, "Mars")

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addGeoJson
function.description:
Add a GeoJson layer specified by the given table to the specified globe.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param table A table with information about the GeoJson layer. See [this page](#globebrowsing_geojsoncomponent) for details on what fields and settings the table may contain

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addGeoJsonFromFile
function.description:
Add a GeoJson layer from the given file name and add it to the current anchor node, if it is a globe. Note that you might have to increase the height offset for the added feature to be visible on the globe, if using a height map.

\param filename The path to the GeoJSON file \param name An optional name that the loaded feature will get in the user interface

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addGibsLayer
function.description: Adds a new layer from NASA GIBS to the Earth globe. Arguments are: imagery layer name, imagery resolution, start date, end date, format. For all specifications, see https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/GIBS/GIBS+Available+Imagery+ProductsUsage:openspace.globebrowsing.addGibsLayer('AIRS_Temperature_850hPa_Night', '2km', '2013-07-15', 'Present', 'png')

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.addLayer
function.description:
Adds a layer to the specified globe. The second argument is the layer group which can be any of the supported layer groups. The third argument is the dictionary defining the layer.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node of which to add the layer. The renderable of the scene graph node must be a [RenderableGlobe](#globebrowsing_renderableglobe) \param layerGroup The identifier of the layer group in which to add the layer \param layer A dictionary defining the layer. See [this page](#globebrowsing_layer) for details on what fields and settings the dictionary may contain

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.capabilitiesWMS
function.description:
Returns an array of tables that describe the available layers that are supported by the WMS server identified by the provided name. The `URL` component of the returned table can be used in the `FilePath` argument for a call to the `addLayer` function to add the value to a globe.

\param name The name of the WMS server for which to get the information

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.createGibsGdalXml
function.description: Creates an XML configuration for a GIBS dataset.Arguments are: layerName, date, resolution, format.For all specifications, see https://wiki.earthdata.nasa.gov/display/GIBS/GIBS+Available+Imagery+ProductsUsage:openspace.globebrowsing.addLayer("Earth","ColorLayers",{Name = "MODIS_Terra_Chlorophyll_A",FilePath = openspace.globebrowsing.createGibsGdalXml("MODIS_Terra_Chlorophyll_A","2013-07-02","1km","png")})

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.createTemporalGibsGdalXml
function.description:
Creates an XML configuration for a temporal GIBS dataset to be used in
            a TemporalTileprovider

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.deleteGeoJson
function.description:
Remove the GeoJson layer specified by the given table or string identifier from the specified globe.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param tableOrIdentifier Either an identifier for the GeoJson layer to be removed, or a table that includes the identifier

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.deleteLayer
function.description:
Removes a layer from the specified globe.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node of which to remove the layer. The renderable of the scene graph node must be a [RenderableGlobe](#globebrowsing_renderableglobe) \param layerGroup The identifier of the layer group from which to remove the layer \param layerOrName Either the identifier for the layer or a dictionary with the `Identifier` key that is used instead

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.flyToGeo
function.description:
Fly the camera to a geographic coordinate (latitude, longitude and altitude) on a globe, using the path navigation system.

\param globe The identifier of a scene graph node that has a RenderableGlobe attached. If an empty string is provided, the current anchor node is used \param latitude The latitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param altitude The altitude of the target coordinate, in meters \param duration An optional duration for the motion to take, in seconds. For example, a value of 5 means "fly to this position over a duration of 5 seconds" \param shouldUseUpVector If true, try to use the up-direction when computing the target position for the camera. For globes, this means that North should be up, in relation to the camera's view direction. Note that for this to take effect, rolling motions must be enabled in the Path Navigator settings.

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.flyToGeo2
function.description:
Fly the camera to a geographic coordinate (latitude and longitude) on a globe, using the path navigation system.

The distance to fly to can either be set to be the current distance of the camera to the target object, or the default distance from the path navigation system.

\param globe The identifier of a scene graph node that has a RenderableGlobe attached. If an empty string is provided, the current anchor node is used \param latitude The latitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param useCurrentDistance If true, use the current distance of the camera to the target globe when going to the specified position. If false, or not specified, set the distance based on the bounding sphere and the distance factor setting in Path Navigator \param duration An optional duration for the motion to take, in seconds. For example, a value of 5 means "fly to this position over a duration of 5 seconds" \param shouldUseUpVector If true, try to use the up-direction when computing the target position for the camera. For globes, this means that North should be up, in relation to the camera's view direction. Note that for this to take effect, rolling motions must be enabled in the Path Navigator settings.

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.geoPositionForCamera
function.description:
Get geographic coordinates of the camera position in latitude, longitude, and altitude (degrees and meters).

\param useEyePosition If true, use the view direction of the camera instead of the camera position

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.getGeoPositionForCamera
function.description:
Get geographic coordinates of the camera position in latitude, longitude, and altitude (degrees and meters).

Deprecated in favor of `geoPositionForCamera`.

\param useEyePosition If true, use the view direction of the camera instead of the camera position

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.getLayers
function.description:
Returns the list of layers for the specified globe for a specific layer group.

Deprecated in favor of `layers`.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param layerGroup The identifier of the layer group for which to list the layers

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.getLocalPositionFromGeo
function.description:
Returns the position in the local Cartesian coordinate system of the specified globe that corresponds to the given geographic coordinates. In the local coordinate system, the position (0,0,0) corresponds to the globe's center.

Deprecated in favor of `localPositionFromGeo`.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param latitude The latitude of the geograpic position, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the geographic position, in degrees \param altitude The altitude, in meters

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.goToChunk
function.description:
Go to the chunk on a globe with given index x, y, level.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param x The x value of the tile index \param y The y value of the tile index \param level The level of the tile index

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.goToGeo
function.description:
Immediately move the camera to a geographic coordinate on a globe.

\param globe The identifier of a scene graph node that has a RenderableGlobe attached. If an empty string is provided, the current anchor node is used \param latitude The latitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param altitude An optional altitude, given in meters over the reference surface of the globe. If no altitude is provided, the altitude will be kept as the current distance to the reference surface of the specified globe.

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.jumpToGeo
function.description:
Immediately move the camera to a geographic coordinate on a globe by first fading the rendering to black, jump to the specified coordinate, and then fade in.

This is done by triggering another script that handles the logic.

\param globe The identifier of a scene graph node that has a RenderableGlobe attached. If an empty string is provided, the current anchor node is used \param latitude The latitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the target coordinate, in degrees \param altitude An optional altitude, given in meters over the reference surface of the globe. If no altitude is provided, the altitude will be kept as the current distance to the reference surface of the specified globe. \param fadeDuration An optional duration for the fading. If not included, the property in Navigation Handler will be used

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.layers
function.description:
Returns the list of layers for the specified globe, for a specific layer group.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param layerGroup The identifier of the layer group for which to list the layers

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.loadWMSCapabilities
function.description:
Loads and parses the WMS capabilities XML file from a remote server.

\param name The name of the capabilities that can be used to later refer to the set of capabilities \param globe The identifier of the globe for which this server is applicable \param url The URL at which the capabilities file can be found

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.loadWMSServersFromFile
function.description: Loads all WMS servers from the provided file and passes them to the 'openspace.globebrowsing.loadWMSCapabilities' file.

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.localPositionFromGeo
function.description:
Returns the position in the local Cartesian coordinate system of the specified globe that corresponds to the given geographic coordinates. In the local coordinate system, the position (0,0,0) corresponds to the globe's center.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node for the globe \param latitude The latitude of the geograpic position, in degrees \param longitude The longitude of the geographic position, in degrees \param altitude The altitude, in meters

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.moveLayer
function.description:
Rearranges the order of a single layer on a globe. The first position in the list has index 0, and the last position is given by the number of layers minus one.

The `source` and `destination` parameters can also be the identifiers of the layers to be moved. If `destination` is a name, the source layer is moved below that destination layer.

\param globeIdentifier The identifier of the globe \param layerGroup The identifier of the layer group \param source The original position of the layer that should be moved, either as an index in the list or the identifier of the layer to be moved \param destination The new position in the list, either as an index in the list or as the identifier of the layer after which to place the moved layer

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.parseInfoFile
function.description: Parses the passed info file and return the table with the information provided in the info file. The return table contains the optional keys: 'Color', 'Height', 'Node', 'Location', 'Identifier'.Usage: local t = openspace.globebrowsing.parseInfoFile(file)openspace.globebrowsing.addLayer("Earth", "ColorLayers", t.color)openspace.globebrowsing.addLayer("Earth", "HeightLayers", t.height)

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.removeWMSServer
function.description:
Removes the specified WMS server from the list of available servers. The name parameter corresponds to the first argument in the `loadWMSCapabilities` call that was used to load the WMS server.

\param name The name of the WMS server to remove

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.setNodePosition
function.description: Sets the position of a SceneGraphNode that has GlobeTranslation/GlobeRotations. Usage: openspace.globebrowsing.setNodePosition("Scale_StatueOfLiberty", "Earth", 40.000, -117.5, optionalAltitude)

function.name: openspace.globebrowsing.setNodePositionFromCamera
function.description: Sets the position of a SceneGraphNode that has GlobeTranslation/GlobeRotations to match the camera. Only uses camera position not rotation. If useAltitude is true, then the position will also be updated to the camera's altitude.Usage: openspace.globebrowsing.setNodePositionFromCamera("Scale_StatueOfLiberty", optionalUseAltitude)

function.name: openspace.iswa.addCdfFiles
function.description: Adds a cdf files to choose from.

function.name: openspace.iswa.addCygnet
function.description: Adds a IswaCygnet.

function.name: openspace.iswa.addKameleonPlanes
function.description: Adds KameleonPlanes from cdf file.

function.name: openspace.iswa.addScreenSpaceCygnet
function.description: Adds a Screen Space Cygnets.

function.name: openspace.iswa.removeCygnet
function.description: Remove a Cygnets.

function.name: openspace.iswa.removeGroup
function.description: Remove a group of Cygnets.

function.name: openspace.iswa.removeScreenSpaceCygnet
function.description: Remove a Screen Space Cygnets.

function.name: openspace.iswa.setBaseUrl
function.description: Sets the base url.

function.name: openspace.modules.isLoaded
function.description: Checks whether the passed OpenSpaceModule is loaded.

function.name: openspace.navigation.addGlobalRoll
function.description:
Directly adds to the global roll of the camera. This is a rotation around the line between the focus node and the camera (not always the same as the camera view direction)

\param value the value to add

function.name: openspace.navigation.addGlobalRotation
function.description:
Directly add to the global rotation of the camera (around the focus node).

\param xValue the value to add in the x-direction (a positive value rotates to the right and a negative value to the left) \param yValue the value to add in the y-direction (a positive value rotates the focus upwards and a negative value downwards)

function.name: openspace.navigation.addLocalRoll
function.description:
Directly adds to the local roll of the camera. This is the rotation around the camera's forward/view direction.

\param value the value to add

function.name: openspace.navigation.addLocalRotation
function.description:
Directly adds to the local rotation of the camera (around the camera's current position).

\param xValue the value to add in the x-direction (a positive value rotates to the left and a negative value to the right) \param yValue the value to add in the y-direction (a positive value rotates the camera upwards and a negative value downwards)

function.name: openspace.navigation.addTruckMovement
function.description:
Directly adds to the truck movement of the camera. This is the movement along the line from the camera to the focus node.

A positive value moves the camera closer to the focus, and a negative value moves the camera further away.

\param value the value to add

function.name: openspace.navigation.axisDeadzone
function.description:
Returns the deadzone for the desired axis of the provided joystick.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller which information should be returned \param axis the joystick axis for which to get the deadzone value

\return the deadzone value

function.name: openspace.navigation.bindJoystickAxis
function.description:
Bind an axis of a joystick to be used as a certain type, and optionally define detailed settings for the axis.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller that should be bound \param axis the axis of the joystick that should be bound \param axisType the type of movement that the axis should be mapped to \param shouldInvert decides if the joystick axis movement should be inverted or not \param joystickType what type of joystick or axis this is. Decides if the joystick behaves more like a joystick or a trigger. Either `"JoystickLike"` or `"TriggerLike"`, where `"JoystickLike"` is default \param isSticky if true, the value is calculated relative to the previous value. If false, the value is used as is \param shouldFlip reverses the movement of the camera that the joystick produces \param sensitivity sensitivity for this axis, in addition to the global sensitivity

function.name: openspace.navigation.bindJoystickAxisProperty
function.description:
Binds an axis of a joystick to a numerical property value in OpenSpace. This means that interacting with the joystick will change the property value, within a given min-max range.

The axis value will be rescaled from [-1, 1] to the provided [min, max] range (default is [0, 1]).

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller that should be bound \param axis the axis of the joystick that should be bound \param propertyUri the identifier (URI) of the property that this joystick axis should modify \param min the minimum value that this axis can set for the property \param max the maximum value that this axis can set for the property \param shouldInvert if the joystick movement should be inverted or not \param isRemote if true, the property change will also be executed on connected nodes. If false, the property change will only affect the master node

function.name: openspace.navigation.bindJoystickButton
function.description:
Bind a Lua script to one of the buttons for a joystick.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller \param button the button to which to bind the script \param command the script that should be executed on button trigger \param documentation the documentation for the provided script/command \param action the action for when the script should be executed. This defaults to `"Press"`, which means that the script is run when the user presses the button. Alternatives are `"Idle"` (if the button is unpressed and has been unpressed since the last frame), `"Repeat"` (if the button has been pressed since longer than the last frame), and `"Release"` (if the button was released since the last frame) \param isRemote a value saying whether the command is going to be executable locally or remotely, where the latter is the default

function.name: openspace.navigation.clearJoystickButton
function.description:
Remove all commands that are currently bound to a button of a joystick or game controller

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller \param button the button for which to clear the commands

function.name: openspace.navigation.distanceToFocus
function.description:
Return the distance to the current focus node.

\return the distance, in meters

function.name: openspace.navigation.distanceToFocusBoundingSphere
function.description:
Return the distance to the current focus node's bounding sphere.

\return the distance, in meters

function.name: openspace.navigation.distanceToFocusInteractionSphere
function.description:
Return the distance to the current focus node's interaction sphere.

\return the distance, in meters

function.name: openspace.navigation.getNavigationState
function.description:
Return the current [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state) as a Lua table.

By default, the reference frame will be picked based on whether the orbital navigator is currently following the anchor node rotation. If it is, the anchor will be chosen as reference frame. If not, the reference frame will be set to the scene graph root.

\param frame the identifier of an optional scene graph node to use as reference frame for the NavigationState

\return a Lua table representing the current NavigationState of the camera

function.name: openspace.navigation.joystickAxis
function.description:
Return all the information bound to a certain joystick axis.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller with the axis for which to find the information \param axis the joystick axis for which to find the information

\return an object with information about the joystick axis

function.name: openspace.navigation.joystickButton
function.description:
Get the Lua script that is currently bound to be executed when the provided button is pressed/triggered.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller \param button the button for which to get the command

\return the currently bound Lua script

function.name: openspace.navigation.listAllJoysticks
function.description:
Return the complete list of connected joysticks.

\return a list of joystick names

function.name: openspace.navigation.loadNavigationState
function.description:
Set the camera position by loading a [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state) from file. The file should be in json format, such as the output files of `saveNavigationState`.

\param filePath the path to the file, including the file name (and extension, if it is anything other than `.navstate`) \param useTimeStamp if true, and the provided NavigationState includes a timestamp, the time will be set as well.

function.name: openspace.navigation.retargetAim
function.description: Reset the camera direction to point at the aim node.

function.name: openspace.navigation.retargetAnchor
function.description: Reset the camera direction to point at the anchor node.

function.name: openspace.navigation.saveNavigationState
function.description:
Save the current [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state) to a file with the path given by the first argument.

By default, the reference frame will be picked based on whether the orbital navigator is currently following the anchor node rotation. If it is, the anchor will be chosen as reference frame. If not, the reference frame will be set to the scene graph root.

\param path the file path for where to save the NavigationState, including the file name. If no extension is added, the file is saved as a `.navstate` file. \param frame the identifier of the scene graph node which coordinate system should be used as a reference frame for the NavigationState.

function.name: openspace.navigation.setAxisDeadZone
function.description:
Set the deadzone value for a particular joystick axis, which means that any input less than this value is completely ignored.

\param joystickName the name for the joystick or game controller \param axis the joystick axis for which to set the deadzone \param deadzone the new deadzone value

function.name: openspace.navigation.setNavigationState
function.description:
Set the camera position from a provided [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state).

\param navigationState a table describing the NavigationState to set \param useTimeStamp if true, and the provided NavigationState includes a timestamp, the time will be set as well

function.name: openspace.navigation.targetNextInterestingAnchor
function.description: Picks the next node from the interesting nodes out of the profile and selects that. If the current anchor is not an interesting node, the first node in the list will be selected.

function.name: openspace.navigation.targetPreviousInterestingAnchor
function.description: Picks the previous node from the interesting nodes out of the profile and selects that. If the current anchor is not an interesting node, the first node in the list will be selected.

function.name: openspace.navigation.triggerIdleBehavior
function.description: Immediately start applying the chosen IdleBehavior. If none is specified, use the one set to default in the OrbitalNavigator.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.extensions
function.description: Returns all available extensions as a list of names.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.glslCompiler
function.description: Returns the value of a call to `glGetString(GL_VENDOR)`. This will give detailed information about the vendor of the main graphics card. This string can be used if the automatic Vendor detection failed.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.gpuVendor
function.description: Returns the vendor of the main graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.hasOpenGLVersion
function.description: Tests whether the current instance supports the passed OpenGL version. The parameter has to have the form 'X.Y' or 'X.Y.Z'.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.isExtensionSupported
function.description: Checks is a specific `extension` is supported or not.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.max2DTextureSize
function.description: Returns the largest dimension for a 2D texture on this graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.max3DTextureSize
function.description: Returns the largest dimension for a 3D texture on this graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.maxAtomicCounterBufferBindings
function.description: Returns the maximum number of atomic counter buffer bindings that are available on the main graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.maxShaderStorageBufferBindings
function.description: Returns the maximum number of shader storage bindings that are available on the main graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.maxTextureUnits
function.description: Returns the maximum number of texture units that are available on the main graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.maxUniformBufferBindings
function.description: Returns the maximum number of uniform buffer bindings that are available on the main graphics card.

function.name: openspace.openglCapabilities.openGLVersion
function.description: Returns the maximum OpenGL version that is supported on this platform.

function.name: openspace.orbitalnavigation.setRelativeMaxDistance
function.description: Set maximum allowed distance to a multiplier of the interaction sphere of the focus node

function.name: openspace.orbitalnavigation.setRelativeMinDistance
function.description: Set minimum allowed distance to a multiplier of the interaction sphere of the focus node

function.name: openspace.parallel.connect
function.description: Connect to parallel.

function.name: openspace.parallel.disconnect
function.description: Disconnect from parallel.

function.name: openspace.parallel.requestHostship
function.description: Request to be the host for this session.

function.name: openspace.parallel.resignHostship
function.description: Resign hostship.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.continuePath
function.description: Continue playing a paused camera path.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.createPath
function.description:
Create a camera path as described by the instruction in the input argument.

\param pathInstruction A table representing a [PathInstruction](#core_path_instruction) that describes a camera path to be created

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.flyTo
function.description: Move the camera to the node with the specified identifier. The optional double specifies the duration of the motion, in seconds. If the optional bool is set to true the target up vector for camera is set based on the target node. Either of the optional parameters can be left out.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.flyToHeight
function.description: Move the camera to the node with the specified identifier. The second argument is the desired target height above the target node's bounding sphere, in meters. The optional double specifies the duration of the motion, in seconds. If the optional bool is set to true, the target up vector for camera is set based on the target node. Either of the optional parameters can be left out.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.flyToNavigationState
function.description:
Create a path to the navigation state described by the input table. Note that roll must be included for the target up direction in the navigation state to be taken into account.

\param navigationState A [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state) to fly to \param duration An optional duration for the motion to take, in seconds. For example, a value of 5 means "fly to this position over a duration of 5 seconds"

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.isFlying
function.description:
Returns true if a camera path is currently running, and false otherwise.

\return Whether a camera path is currently active, or not

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.jumpTo
function.description:
Fade rendering to black, jump to the specified navigation state, and then fade in. This is done by triggering another script that handles the logic.

\param nodeIdentifier The identifier of the scene graph node to jump to \param fadeDuration An optional duration for the fading. If not included, the property in Navigation Handler will be used

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.jumpToNavigationState
function.description:
Fade rendering to black, jump to the specified node, and then fade in. This is done by triggering another script that handles the logic.

\param navigationState A [NavigationState](#core_navigation_state) to jump to \param fadeDuration An optional duration for the fading. If not included, the property in Navigation Handler will be used

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.pausePath
function.description: Pause a playing camera path.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.skipToEnd
function.description: Immediately skips to the end of the current camera path, if one is being played.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.stopPath
function.description: Stops a path, if one is being played.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.zoomToDistance
function.description:
Fly linearly to a specific distance in relation to the focus node.

\param distance The distance to fly to, in meters above the bounding sphere. \param duration An optional duration for the motion to take, in seconds.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.zoomToDistanceRelative
function.description:
Fly linearly to a specific distance in relation to the focus node, given as a relative value based on the size of the object rather than in meters.

\param distance The distance to fly to, given as a multiple of the bounding sphere of the current focus node bounding sphere. A value of 1 will result in a position at a distance of one times the size of the bounding sphere away from the object. \param duration An optional duration for the motion, in seconds.

function.name: openspace.pathnavigation.zoomToFocus
function.description:
Zoom linearly to the current focus node, using the default distance.

\param duration An optional duration for the motion to take, in seconds. For example, a value of 5 means "zoom in over 5 seconds"

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.clear
function.description: Clears all scheduled scripts.

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.loadFile
function.description: Load timed scripts from a Lua script file that returns a list of scheduled scripts.

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.loadScheduledScript
function.description: Load a single scheduled script. The first argument is the time at which the scheduled script is triggered, the second argument is the script that is executed in the forward direction, the optional third argument is the script executed in the backwards direction, and the optional last argument is the universal script, executed in either direction.

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.scheduledScripts
function.description: Returns the list of all scheduled scripts

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.setModeApplicationTime
function.description: Sets the time reference for scheduled scripts to application time (seconds since OpenSpace application started).

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.setModeRecordedTime
function.description: Sets the time reference for scheduled scripts to the time since the recording was started (the same relative time applies to playback).

function.name: openspace.scriptScheduler.setModeSimulationTime
function.description: Sets the time reference for scheduled scripts to the simulated date & time (J2000 epoch seconds).

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.disableTakeScreenShotDuringPlayback
function.description: Used to disable that renderings are saved during playback.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.enableTakeScreenShotDuringPlayback
function.description: Enables that rendered frames should be saved during playback. The parameter determines the number of frames that are exported per second if this value is not provided, 60 frames per second will be exported.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.fileFormatConversion
function.description: Performs a conversion of the specified file to the most most recent file format, creating a copy of the recording file.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.isPlayingBack
function.description: Returns true if session recording is currently playing back a recording.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.isRecording
function.description: Returns true if session recording is currently recording a recording.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.setPlaybackPause
function.description: Pauses or resumes the playback progression through keyframes.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startPlayback
function.description: Starts a playback session with keyframe times that are relative to the time since the recording was started (the same relative time applies to the playback). When playback starts, the simulation time is automatically set to what it was at recording time. The string argument is the filename to pull playback keyframes from (the file path is relative to the RECORDINGS variable specified in the config file). If a second input value of true is given, then playback will continually loop until it is manually stopped.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startPlaybackApplicationTime
function.description: Starts a playback session with keyframe times that are relative to application time (seconds since OpenSpace application started). The string argument is the filename to pull playback keyframes from (the file path is relative to the RECORDINGS variable specified in the config file).

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startPlaybackRecordedTime
function.description: Starts a playback session with keyframe times that are relative to the time since the recording was started (the same relative time applies to the playback). The string argument is the filename to pull playback keyframes from (the file path is relative to the RECORDINGS variable specified in the config file). If a second input value of true is given, then playback will continually loop until it is manually stopped.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startPlaybackSimulationTime
function.description: Starts a playback session with keyframe times that are relative to the simulated date & time. The string argument is the filename to pull playback keyframes from (the file path is relative to the RECORDINGS variable specified in the config file).

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startRecording
function.description: Starts a recording session. The string argument is the filename used for the file where the recorded keyframes are saved. The file data format is binary.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.startRecordingAscii
function.description: Starts a recording session. The string argument is the filename used for the file where the recorded keyframes are saved. The file data format is ASCII.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.stopPlayback
function.description: Stops a playback session before playback of all keyframes is complete.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.stopRecording
function.description: Stops a recording session.

function.name: openspace.sessionRecording.togglePlaybackPause
function.description: Toggles the pause function, i.e. temporarily setting the delta time to 0 and restoring it afterwards.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.addDisplayCopy
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser and adds a rendered copy to it. The first argument is the position of the first copy. The position is in RAE or Cartesian coordinates, depending on if 'Use Radius Azimuth Elevation' is checked. The second argument is the number of copies. If RAE is used, they will be evenly spread out on the azimuth.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.addPairToSkyBrowserModule
function.description: Takes the identifier of the sky target and a sky browser and adds them to the sky browser module.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.adjustCamera
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or sky target. Rotates the camera so that the target is placed in the center of the view.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.centerTargetOnScreen
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser and animates its corresponding target to the center of the current view.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.createTargetBrowserPair
function.description: Creates a sky browser and a target.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.disableHoverCircle
function.description: Disables the hover circle, if there is one added to the sky browser module.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.finetuneTargetPosition
function.description: Finetunes the target depending on a mouse drag. rendered copy to it. First argument is the identifier of the sky browser, second is the start position of the drag and third is the end position of the drag.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.getListOfImages
function.description: Deprecated in favor of 'listOfExoplanets'

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.getTargetData
function.description: Deprecated in favor of 'targetData'

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.getWwtImageCollectionUrl
function.description: Deprecated in favor of 'wwtImageCollectionUrl'

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.initializeBrowser
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser and starts the initialization for that browser. That means that the browser starts to try to connect to the AAS WorldWide Telescope application by sending it messages. And that the target matches its appearance to its corresponding browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.listOfImages
function.description: Returns a list of all the loaded AAS WorldWide Telescope images that have been loaded. Each image has a name, thumbnail url, equatorial spherical coordinates RA and Dec, equatorial Cartesian coordinates, if the image has celestial coordinates, credits text, credits url and the identifier of the image which is a unique number.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.loadImagesToWWT
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or target and loads the WWT image collection to that browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.loadingImageCollectionComplete
function.description: Sets the image collection as loaded in the sky browser. Takes an identifier to the sky browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.moveCircleToHoverImage
function.description: Moves the hover circle to the coordinate specified by the image index.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.reloadDisplayCopyOnNode
function.description: Reloads the sky browser display copy for the node index that is sent in. .If no ID is sent in, it will reload all display copies on that node.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.removeDisplayCopy
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser and removes the latest added rendered copy to it.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.removeSelectedImageInBrowser
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or target and an index to an image. Removes that image from that sky browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.removeTargetBrowserPair
function.description: Takes in identifier to a sky browser or target and removes them.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.scrollOverBrowser
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or a sky target and a vertical field of view. Changes the field of view as specified by the input.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.selectImage
function.description: Takes an index to an image and selects that image in the currently selected sky browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.sendOutIdsToBrowsers
function.description: Sends all sky browsers' identifiers to their respective CEF browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setBorderColor
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or a sky target and a rgb color in the ranges [0, 255].

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setBorderRadius
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser and a radius value between 0 and 1, where 0 is rectangular and 1 is circular

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setBrowserRatio
function.description: Sets the screen space size of the sky browser to the numbers specified by the input [x, y].

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setEquatorialAim
function.description: Takes the identifier of a sky browser or a sky target and equatorial coordinates Right Ascension and Declination. The target will animate to this coordinate and the browser will display the coordinate.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setHoverCircle
function.description: Takes an identifier to a screen space renderable and adds it to the module.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setImageLayerOrder
