function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or a sky target, an image index and the order which it should have in the selected image list. The image is then changed to have this order.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setOpacityOfImageLayer
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or sky target, an index to an image and a value for the opacity.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setSelectedBrowser
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or target. Sets that sky browser currently selected.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.setVerticalFov
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or a sky target and a vertical field of view. Changes the field of view as specified by the input.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.showAllTargetsAndBrowsers
function.description: Show or hide all targets and browsers. Takes a boolean that sets it to either be shown or not.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.startFinetuningTarget
function.description: Starts the fine-tuning of the target rendered copy to it.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.startSetup
function.description: Starts the setup process of the sky browers. This function calls the Lua function 'sendOutIdsToBrowsers' in all nodes in the cluster.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.stopAnimations
function.description: Stop animations. Takes an identifier to a sky browser.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.targetData
function.description: Returns a table of data regarding the current view and the sky browsers and targets. returns a table of data regarding the current targets.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.translateScreenSpaceRenderable
function.description: Takes an identifier to a sky browser or sky target and the [x, y] starting position and the [x, y] translation vector.

function.name: openspace.skybrowser.wwtImageCollectionUrl
function.description: Returns the AAS WorldWide Telescope image collection url.

function.name: openspace.space.convertFromRaDec
function.description: Returns the cartesian world position of a ra dec coordinate with distance. If the coordinate is given as strings the format should be ra 'XhYmZs' and dec 'XdYmZs'. If the coordinate is given as numbers the values should be in degrees.

function.name: openspace.space.convertToRaDec
function.description: Returns the formatted ra, dec strings and distance for a given cartesian world coordinate.

function.name: openspace.space.tleToSpiceTranslation
function.description:
Takes the provided TLE file, converts it into a SPICE kernel and returns a
        SpiceTranslation instance that can be used to access the information in the TLE
        file using SPICE's superior integral solver.

        The second return value is the spice kernel that should be loaded and unloaded by
        whoever called this function.

function.name: openspace.spice.convertTLEtoSPK
function.description:
This function converts a TLE file into SPK format and saves it at the provided path. The last parameter is only used if there are multiple craft specified in the provided TLE file and is selecting which (0-based index) of the list to create a kernel from.

This function returns the SPICE ID of the object for which the kernel was created

function.name: openspace.spice.kernels
function.description: Returns a list of all loaded kernels

function.name: openspace.spice.loadKernel
function.description: Loads the provided SPICE kernel by name. The name can contain path tokens, which are automatically resolved.

function.name: openspace.spice.position
function.description: Returns the position for a given body relative to another body, in a given frame of reference, at a specific time. Example: openspace.spice.position('INSIGHT', 'MARS',' GALACTIC', '2018 NOV 26 19:45:34')

function.name: openspace.spice.rotationMatrix
function.description: Returns the rotationMatrix for a given body in a frame of reference at a specific time. Example: openspace.spice.rotationMatrix('INSIGHT_LANDER_CRUISE','MARS', '2018 NOV 26 19:45:34')

function.name: openspace.spice.spiceBodies
function.description: Returns a list of Spice Bodies loaded into the system. Returns SPICE built in frames if builtInFrames. Returns User loaded frames if !builtInFrames.

function.name: openspace.spice.unloadKernel
function.description: Unloads the provided SPICE kernel. The name can contain path tokens, which are automatically resolved.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.canGoToState
function.description: Returns true if there is a defined transition between the current state and the given string name of a state, otherwise false.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.createStateMachine
function.description: Creates a state machine from a list of states and transitions. See State and Transition documentation for details. The optional thrid argument is the identifier of the desired initial state. If left out, the first state in the list will be used.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.currentState
function.description: Returns the string name of the current state that the statemachine is in.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.destroyStateMachine
function.description: Destroys the current state machine and deletes all the memory.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.goToState
function.description: Triggers a transition from the current state to the state with the given identifier. Requires that the specified string corresponds to an existing state, and that a transition between the two states exists.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.possibleTransitions
function.description: Returns a list with the identifiers of all the states that can be transitioned to from the current state.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.printCurrentStateInfo
function.description: Prints information about the current state and possible transitions to the log.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.saveToDotFile
function.description: Saves the current state machine to a .dot file as a directed graph. The resulting graph can be rendered using external tools such as Graphviz. The first parameter is the name of the file, and the second is an optional directory. If no directory is given, the file is saved to the temp folder.

function.name: openspace.statemachine.setInitialState
function.description: Immediately sets the current state to the state with the given name, if it exists. This is done without doing a transition and completely ignores the previous state.

function.name: openspace.sync.syncResource
function.description: Synchronizes the http resource identified by the name passed as the first parameter and the version provided as the second parameter. The application will hang while the data is being downloaded.

function.name: openspace.sync.unsyncResource
function.description: Unsynchronizes the http resources identified by the name passed as the first parameter by removing all data that was downloaded as part of the original synchronization. If the second parameter is provided, is it the version of the resources that is unsynchronized, if the parameter is not provided, all versions for the specified http resource are removed.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.cacheLineSize
function.description: Returns the cache line size.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.cacheSize
function.description: Returns the cache size.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.cores
function.description: Returns the number of cores.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.extensions
function.description: Returns all supported exteions as comma-separated string.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.fullOperatingSystem
function.description: Returns the operating system as a string. The exact format of the returned string is implementation and operating system-dependent but it should contain the manufacturer and the version.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.installedMainMemory
function.description: Returns the amount of available, installed main memory (RAM) on the system in MB.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.L2Associativity
function.description: Returns the L2 associativity.

function.name: openspace.systemCapabilities.os
function.description: This function returns a string identifying the currently running operating system. For Windows, the string is 'windows', for MacOS, it is 'osx', and for Linux it is 'linux'. For any other operating system, this function returns 'other'.

function.name: openspace.time.advancedTime
function.description: Modifies the passed time (first argument) by the delta time (second argument). The first argument can either be an ISO 8601 date string or the number of seconds past the J2000 epoch. The second argument can either be a string of the form [-]XX(s,m,h,d,M,y] with (s)econds, (m)inutes, (h)ours, (d)ays, (M)onths, and (y)ears as units and an optional - sign to move backwards in time. If the second argument is a number, it is interpreted as a number of seconds. The return value is of the same type as the first argument.

function.name: openspace.time.convertTime
function.description:
Converts the given time to either a J2000 seconds number or a ISO 8601 timestamp, depending on the type of the given time.

If the given time is a timestamp: the function returns a double precision value representing the ephemeris version of that time; that is the number of TDB seconds past the J2000 epoch.

If the given time is a J2000 seconds value: the function returns a ISO 8601 timestamp.

function.name: openspace.time.currentApplicationTime
function.description: Returns the current application time as the number of seconds since the OpenSpace application started.

function.name: openspace.time.currentTime
function.description: Returns the current time as the number of seconds since the J2000 epoch.

function.name: openspace.time.currentWallTime
function.description: Returns the current wall time as an ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MN-SS) in the UTC timezone.

function.name: openspace.time.deltaTime
function.description: Returns the amount of simulated time that passes in one second of real time.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolateDeltaTime
function.description: Sets the amount of simulation time that happens in one second of real time. If a second input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolateNextDeltaTimeStep
function.description: Interpolate the simulation speed to the first delta time step in the list that is larger than the current simulation speed, if any. If an input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolatePause
function.description: Same behaviour as setPause, but with interpolation. If no interpolation duration is provided, the interpolation time will be based on the `defaultPauseInterpolationDuration` and `defaultUnpauseInterpolationDuration` properties of the TimeManager.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolatePreviousDeltaTimeStep
function.description: Interpolate the simulation speed to the first delta time step in the list that is smaller than the current simulation speed, if any. If an input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolateTime
function.description: Sets the current simulation time to the specified value. If the first parameter is a number, the target is the number of seconds past the J2000 epoch. If it is a string, it has to be a valid ISO 8601-like date string of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MN:SS (Note: providing time zone using the Z format is not supported. UTC is assumed). If a second input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolateTimeRelative
function.description: Increments the current simulation time by the specified number of seconds. If a second input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.interpolateTogglePause
function.description: Toggles the pause function, i.e. temporarily setting the delta time to 0 and restoring it afterwards. If an input value is given, the interpolation is done over the specified number of seconds.

function.name: openspace.time.isPaused
function.description: Returns whether the simulation time is currently paused or is progressing.

function.name: openspace.time.pauseToggleViaKeyboard
function.description: This allows for a keypress (via keybinding) to have dual functionality. In normal operational mode it will behave just like time_interpolateTogglePause, but during playback of a session recording it will pause the playback without manipulating the delta time.

function.name: openspace.time.setDeltaTime
function.description: Sets the amount of simulation time that happens in one second of real time.

function.name: openspace.time.setDeltaTimeSteps
function.description: Sets the list of discrete delta time steps for the simulation speed that can be quickly jumped between. The list will be sorted to be in increasing order. A negative verison of each specified time step will be added per default as well.

function.name: openspace.time.setNextDeltaTimeStep
function.description: Immediately set the simulation speed to the first delta time step in the list that is larger than the current choice of simulation speed, if any.

function.name: openspace.time.setPause
function.description: Toggles a pause function i.e. setting the delta time to 0 and restoring it afterwards.

function.name: openspace.time.setPreviousDeltaTimeStep
function.description: Immediately set the simulation speed to the first delta time step in the list that is smaller than the current choice of simulation speed if any.

function.name: openspace.time.setTime
function.description: Sets the current simulation time to the specified value. If the parameter is a number, the value is the number of seconds past the J2000 epoch. If it is a string, it has to be a valid ISO 8601-like date string of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MN:SS. Note: providing time zone using the Z format is not supported. UTC is assumed.

function.name: openspace.time.SPICE
function.description: Returns the current time as an date string of the form (YYYY MON DDTHR:MN:SC.### ::RND) as returned by SPICE.

function.name: openspace.time.togglePause
function.description: Toggles the pause function, i.e. temporarily setting the delta time to 0 and restoring it afterwards.

function.name: openspace.time.UTC
function.description: Returns the current time as an ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MN:SS).
